1.6.1.title: Well Control Response Team
1.6.1.content:
The Well Control Response Team comprises all personnel with roles in well control prevention, detection, and response. Team composition varies by operation type but core roles include:

- Responsible Person (OIM/Rig Manager)
- Drilling Supervisor/Superintendent
- Toolpusher
- Driller
- Assistant Driller
- Mud Engineer
- Mud Logger
- Subsea Supervisor/Engineer (subsea operations)
- Operator Representative

All team members shall:
- Hold appropriate certifications for their role
- Understand their specific responsibilities
- Be familiar with current well conditions
- Participate in well control drills
- Maintain readiness to respond

1.6.2.title: Responsible Person (OIM/Rig Manager)
1.6.2.content:
The Responsible Person has overall charge of the installation and well control operations.

**Responsibilities:**
- Ultimate accountability for well control on the installation
- Ensure adequate resources for well control
- Chair well control status meetings
- Approve well control procedures and bridging documents
- Ensure competent personnel are assigned
- Authorize emergency actions
- Notify shore base of well control events
- Ensure regulatory compliance

**Authority:**
- Full authority over all operations on the installation
- Authority to shut down operations for safety
- Authority to mobilize emergency response resources

**Delegation:**
- Must designate a competent stand-in when absent
- Delegation does not relieve accountability

1.6.3.title: Drilling Supervisor/Superintendent
1.6.3.content:
The Drilling Supervisor provides technical leadership for drilling operations including well control.

**Responsibilities:**
- Implement well control procedures
- Ensure crew competency and readiness
- Verify equipment readiness and testing
- Lead pre-spud and operational meetings
- Supervise well control drills
- First-line decision making during events
- Interface with Operator Representative
- Ensure proper documentation
- Report events to management

**During Well Control Events:**
- Take charge of well control operations
- Direct kill operations
- Coordinate with shore-based support
- Ensure proper recording of data

1.6.4.title: Toolpusher
1.6.4.content:
The Toolpusher supervises drilling floor operations and crew.

**Responsibilities:**
- Direct supervision of drilling crew
- Ensure procedures are followed
- Monitor crew performance and alertness
- Conduct crew briefings and handovers
- Verify equipment status
- Support Driller during operations
- Act as Drilling Supervisor when delegated

**During Well Control Events:**
- Present on drill floor to support Driller
- Manage additional personnel as needed
- Coordinate with other departments
- Maintain communication with Supervisor

1.6.5.title: Driller
1.6.5.content:
The Driller is responsible for direct control of the well and immediate response to well control events.

**Responsibilities:**
- Primary responsibility for well control at all times
- Monitor all well parameters continuously
- Detect kicks and other abnormal conditions
- Execute shut-in procedures
- Operate BOP and choke during well control
- Maintain awareness of well status
- Ensure relief Driller is properly briefed
- Document all significant events

**Authority:**
- **ABSOLUTE AUTHORITY to shut in the well without seeking permission from any supervisor**
- This authority cannot be overridden
- No person shall be penalized for shutting in the well in good faith

**During Well Control Events:**
- Execute immediate shut-in
- Record shut-in pressures
- Operate choke during kill operations
- Maintain pressure control
- Follow Supervisor's direction for kill method

1.6.6.title: Assistant Driller
1.6.6.content:
The Assistant Driller supports the Driller and monitors well parameters.

**Responsibilities:**
- Monitor pit volumes, flow rates, and returns
- Alert Driller to any anomalies
- Maintain trip sheets and fill records
- Assist with BOP and equipment operation
- Support shut-in procedures
- Monitor solids control equipment
- Act as Driller when designated

**During Well Control Events:**
- Support Driller with monitoring
- Record data as directed
- Operate equipment as assigned
- Maintain communication

1.6.7.title: Mud Engineer
1.6.7.content:
The Mud Engineer maintains the drilling fluid system and supports well control.

**Responsibilities:**
- Maintain mud properties per program
- Ensure adequate mud volume and weight-up materials
- Monitor mud returns for gas and cuttings
- Advise on mud-related well control issues
- Prepare kill mud when required
- Document mud properties

**During Well Control Events:**
- Prepare kill mud to required weight
- Monitor mud properties during circulation
- Advise on mud-related complications
- Ensure materials availability

1.6.8.title: Mud Logger
1.6.8.content:
The Mud Logger provides continuous monitoring and documentation of well parameters.

**Responsibilities:**
- Monitor and record drilling parameters
- Monitor and record gas levels
- Track pit volumes and flow
- Alert Driller to anomalies
- Maintain drilling logs
- Support kick detection

**During Well Control Events:**
- Continuous recording of all parameters
- Record time stamps for all events
- Monitor gas composition if H2S capable
- Provide data for post-event analysis

1.6.9.title: Subsea Supervisor/Engineer
1.6.9.content:
For subsea operations, the Subsea Supervisor/Engineer manages subsea equipment including the BOP.

**Responsibilities:**
- Ensure subsea BOP readiness
- Monitor BOP control system
- Conduct BOP testing
- Present at control panel during critical operations
- Manage ROV operations related to BOP
- Maintain subsea equipment records

**During Well Control Events:**
- Man BOP control panel
- Execute BOP functions as directed
- Monitor hydraulic and electrical systems
- Support emergency disconnect if required
- Advise on subsea complications

1.6.10.title: Operator Representative
1.6.10.content:
The Operator Representative represents the well owner's interests and provides oversight.

**Responsibilities:**
- Verify operations comply with program and regulations
- Interface between rig and operator engineering
- Coordinate with shore base
- Observe and report on operations
- Participate in well control meetings
- Support incident investigation
- Environmental responsibilities as designated

**During Well Control Events:**
- Observe and document
- Communicate with shore base
- Do not interfere with rig crew's response
- Coordinate additional resources if needed
- Support regulatory notifications

1.6.11.title: Service Company Personnel
1.6.11.content:
Various service company personnel support well control operations:

**Cementer:**
- Maintain cementing equipment ready for emergency use
- Ensure cement and additives available
- Support bullheading or squeeze operations

**Directional Driller/MWD Engineer:**
- Provide downhole data if tools in hole
- Support kick detection with PWD data
- Advise on tool limitations during well control

**All Service Personnel:**
- Understand their role in emergency response
- Muster and respond per emergency plan
- Support operations as directed
- Not interfere with well control response
